channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Household goodes dumped on the pedestrian walkway, blocking it compliteley, 24th October
item.description:
Loads of household items, mattresses, bed frames and other stuff just chucked on the street blocking the walkway conpliteley. Impossible for someone with a buggy or whealchair to pass. Addres is 11 Mabley Street. Its been present whole day today 24th Oct

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mabley Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leafa, 24th October
item.description:
I have noticed the odd side of the road the leafs are not cleaned and the street sweeper avoiding that side as it's too much work to do. It's been months no one cleaned the pavement and nr73 is not able to do at all as they are too old for this job and the leafs just gathering on the pavement. Can I ask you tell the company who cleans the street that that side of the road is also part of the job to do? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crystal Palace Park Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked surface water gullies, 24th October
item.description:
Odd numbered side of casewick road several gullies up to tredwell road turning are blocked with sand and earth etc. - when it rains heavily these do not take any water and it runs over them down to the gulley outside 17/19. The same happens on the south side of thornlaw road. All the water runs outside our house and then floods our property. This has been happening since we moved in 2017. We have reported the problems several times and nothing has been done about it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Casewick Road, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Request for Urgent Deep Clean of Public Right of Way, 24th October
item.description:
I am writing to raise a concern regarding the Public Right of Way footpath that runs from King Hall Road up to Clock House. The pathway has become severely overgrown and has not been cleaned for several months. This neglect is now posing a health and safety risk to the public. Additionally, the public waste bin located in the alley is consistently missed during routine collections, which further contributes to the issue. Could you please arrange for a deep clean of the footpath and ensure the waste bin is included in future collection rounds? Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kings Hall Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
